text: George Hugh Tinkham (born April 8, 1946) is a Canadian politician. He represented the electoral districts of Yarmouth County, and Argyle in the Nova Scotia House of Assembly from 1974 to 1984. He was a member of the Nova Scotia Liberal Party. ==Career== Born in 1946 at Yarmouth, Nova Scotia, Tinkham entered provincial politics in the 1974 election, winning the dual-member Yarmouth County riding with fellow Liberal Fraser Mooney. He was re-elected along with Mooney in the 1978 election. In the 1981 election, Tinkham was re- elected in the new Argyle riding. He did not seek re-election in 1984. Following his political career, Tinkham worked as a real estate agent. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:Nova Scotia Liberal Party MLAs Category:People from Yarmouth, Nova Scotia
title: Hugh Tinkham
